title: Queen Letizia of Spain attends a language and journalism seminar in La Rioja
text:
Showcasing her ability to turn neutral business attire into fashion-forward chic, Queen Letizia stepped out today in La Rioja wearing autumnal monochrome.

The monarch, 47, teamed a beige v-neck knit with tailored black trousers, complete with a belt to accentuate her enviable figure.

The Spanish royal beamed as she met with experts from several countries to discuss the issues surrounding the communications industry at the inauguration of the 14th International Seminar of Language and Journalism.

It was no doubt an engagement of particular interest to the Queen, who worked as a journalist before marrying King Felipe of Spain.

Queen Letizia of Spain (pictured) attended an annual language and journalism seminar in La Rioja, Spain

The 47-year-old took time to take photographs with attendees after joining discussions about the issues surrounding language and journalism in Spain

The Spanish royal teamed a nude lipstick with bronze makeup for a radiant, natural look

Presiding over the seminar, Queen Letizia opted for makeup that enhanced her natural features, with a nude lipstick and slight bronzer on her cheeks.

She wore her hair in loose waves, parted at the side for an effortlessly polished look.

The mother-of-two was met by the president of La Rioja and the San Millán de la Cogolla Foundation, Concepción Andreu as well as the president of the Parliament of La Rioja, Jesús María García.

The language and journalism seminar aims to address ethical, social and linguistic perspectives across oral and written communication.

Other authorities in attendance included the delegate of the Government La Rioja, José Ignacio Pérez and the mayor of San Millán, Raquel Fernández.

Queen Letizia (pictured centre) was met by authorities including was met by the president of La Rioja, San Millan de la Cogolla

Letizia appeared delighted to speak with children, after being given access to the International Research Center of the Spanish Language and the library

Despite having had a busy week, with a visit to a flooded area of Spain alongside her husband of 15 years, King Felipe VI, Queen Letizia appeared in good spirits.

The 47-year-old, who previously worked as a reporter for the news channel 24 Horas, joined a debate on 'Spanish and machines: language, ethics and journalism' as part of the seminar.

Organized by the San Millán de la Cogolla Foundation and the BBVA Fundéu, the annual seminar has bought together esteemed journalists and language experts since 2006.

Queen Letizia spent time taking group photographs after being given access to the International Research Center of the Spanish Language and the library.

The 47-year-old teamed a beige v-neck knit with black tailored trousers and matching court heels for effortless style

The mother-of-two has had a busy week, with a visit to a flooded area of Spain alongside her husband, King Felipe VI

King Felipe VI who shares two children with Queen Letizia, Princesses Leonor, 13, and Sofia, 11, was meanwhile in audience with delegations of the Congress of the United States of America who are visiting Spain.

The couple have been married since 2004, after making vows at the Almudena Cathedral at Royal Palace, Madrid.

Queen Letizia left her career as a journalist just months after getting engaged to King Felipe, and went on to take her first solo engagement on June 23rd 2014.

description: Queen Letizia of Spain, 47, made a stylish appearance in autumnal monochrome as she attended the inauguration of the 14th International Seminar of Language and Journalism in La Rioja.
